conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball under the influence of the electric field and gravity.
The forces acting on the ball are electric force and gravitational force.
Electric force is given by F_electric = qE, where q is the charge of the ball.
Gravitational force is given by F_gravity = mg, where m is the mass of the ball.
The ball starts at point O with an initial velocity v_0 at an angle θ to the horizontal.
The ball moves along a straight line at an angle θ to the opposite direction of the electric field.
The net force acting on the ball is balanced such that the ball maintains a straight-line trajectory.
Electric potential energy U_electric of a charged particle in an electric field is given by U_electric = qV.
Electric potential difference between two points in a uniform electric field is related to the displacement along the direction of the field: ΔV = -E Δx.
Change in electric potential energy is ΔU_electric = q ΔV = -qE Δx.
At the highest point, the ball has moved horizontally by a distance Δx.
Horizontal displacement Δx is related to the vertical displacement Δy by the angle θ: Δx = Δy cot θ.
Substitute Δx = Δy cot θ into the expression for ΔU_electric: ΔU_electric = -qE (Δy cot θ).
Δy is the vertical displacement of the ball at the highest point relative to point O.
The difference in electric potential energy of the small ball when it reaches the highest point compared to its electric potential energy at point O is ΔU_electric = -qE (Δy cot θ).
